dataset.title: Bulk density, organic matter content, and total carbon, nitrogen, and phosphorus content of soils collected from Acomastylis rossii and Kobresia myosuroides paired plots.

address.deliveryPoint: Institute of Arctic and Alpine Research

abstract.para: This study was initiated to examine bulk density and organic matter content differences between soils where Acomastylis rossii and Kobresia myosuroides were present. A subset of samples were also measured for total C, N, and P. Paired plots were randomly selected in locations where Kobresia and Acomastylis populations were adjacent to one another. Soil samples were collected from 35 plots, 22 and 13 of which had southerly and northerly aspects, respectively. Soil cores were removed with 3.5-cm interior diameter PVC pipe that was driven into the tundra by use of a rubber mallet. The minimum depth of individual cores was 9 cm, and these depths were recorded at the time of removal (15 July, 19 July, 22 July, and 9 August 1993).

description.para: The initial iteration of the documentation section of this file was generated by Roberto Cortinas and Rick Ingersoll in early June of 1994. The data for 1993 were added to the data section and the file was put under sccs control on 3 June 1994.[RCI 3 June 1994] Comments were provided by Tim Seastedt and incorporated into the documentation section on 22 June 1994.[RCI 22 June 1994] Total C, N, and P data were inserted into the data section and appropriate comments were inserted into the abstract and comments section on 3 January 1997.[MAH 3 January 1997]
